data.title: debug hint when using equal symbol instead of passing value to be set or upgrade to syntax checker.
data.body:
I was incorrectly using the following on a label:

```
get_node("name").set_text = "Bob"
```

Which at run time game me this error:

```
Invalid set index 'set_text' (on base: 'Label')
```

This error is very vague as everywhere shows that "set_text" is indeed the correct call.
The correct code is:

```
get_node("name").set_text("Bob")
```

At the very least could this error message be updated to:

```
Invalid set index 'set_text' (on base: 'Label'). Use '.set_text(value)' instead of '.set_text = value'.
```

But what would be even better is for the Code Editor to detect this like any typo instantly highlighting the line in red and displaying this error:

```
Use '.set_property(value)' instead of '.set_property = value'.
```

data.title: Allowing CenterContainer to Center at a point instead of the middle of zone.
data.body:
I recommend this improvement to CenterContainer (following Label's conventions):
 Add as the very first properties "CenterContainer.Align" & "CenterContainer.Valign".
 CenterContainer.Align can be set to (CenterOnLeft, CenterOnCenter, CenterOnRight) & 
 CenterContainer.Valign can be set to (CenterOnTop, CenterOnCenter, CenterOnBottom)

data.title: Control.Margin does not allow decimal ratio when Control.Anchor is set to ratio.
data.body: After changing a Control's Anchor's all to Ratios I was unable to set the Margin's to "-0.5". It would allow me to set it to negative and positive whole numbers but not a decimal ratio.

data.title: Node children always position themselves from the parent node's non-centered state.
data.body: The Location & Size system seams to broken in that it ignores how centering changes node locations. a When a parent node toggles between centered and not centered all of its children nodes should move with it.

data.title: In Scene & Resources Tabs selecting node does not display node in 2D or Script Tab consistently
data.body:
In Scene & Resources Tabs selecting node does not display node in 2D or Script Tab consistently.

Create a scene, a node it in, link a script to that node, create a few subnodes, create another script not linked to any nodes.

Correct way: When you are in viewing the 2D Tab, select the Resources Tab and select a script that is NOT currently selected then it automatically changes to the Script Tab with that script open.
Bug: When you are in viewing the 2D Tab, select the Resources Tab and select the script that IS currently selected then it does NOT automatically change to the Script Tab with that script open.

Correct way: When you are in viewing the Script Tab, select the Scene Tab and select a node that is NOT the root node with the script then it automatically changes to the 2D Tab with that node open.
Bug: When you are in viewing the Script Tab, select the Scene Tab and select a node that IS the root node with the script then it does NOT automatically change to the 2D Tab with that node open.

data.title: couple tab and tab container fixes
data.body: couple tab and tab container fixes

data.title: feature request: set_mouse_pos() to warp cursor
data.body:
I think Godot should have a function like this: Input.set_mouse_pos(Vector2 pos) to warp the cursor around the scene as necessary.

If such a function already exists, I could not find it.

data.title: Prevend timer from processing inside the editor
data.body: If timer was set to autostart - it would start processing inside the editor. This patch prevends it from doing that.

data.title: Someone fixed compiling issue on Win
data.body:
I'm not taking any credits, so I'm just going to paste Juans email.

"Subject: Bug fixes for godot windows compile

Comments:
 Hi, I found and fixed a couple of errors in the compilation of godot for
windows,
I'm using windows 8.1 and Visual Studio 2013 Update 3,

I changed rand.h in C:\godot-master\drivers\builtin_openssl2\openssl\rand.h
...
to avoid redefinition errors, and I changed C:\godot-master\drivers\builtin_openssl2\crypto\o_str.c
...
to use proper string for win32"

data.title: gui anchors bug (tutorial_gui_repositioning)
data.body: not a bug - all works perfectly if parent is of type Control, not Node2D!

data.title: "Save Resource As.." does not function like "Save Scene As.." might need "Clone Resource As.."
data.body:
For part of my development I was using some scenes and resources as templates to copy.

For the scene, I just opened up a scene, went to the "Scene" menu selected "Save Resource As..", entered my copy's name, and I had a copy.

For an AtlasTexture, I found it's Resource, clicked the "Save Resource" button, selected "Save Resource As..", and I had a copy. But wait it changed all my property pointers to point to the new resource instead of the old one. Ugh, and the undo doesn't work, maybe if I just "Save Resource As.." back to the old name it will save me from HOURS of fixing this (if I was working on a large project). Having to click okay to "File Exists, Overwrite?" message, easy for something to go wrong... 
What the heck? I have no idea if it Overwritted the resource because it created a new resource with a generic name (like using the new button) and linked that to all my property pointers throughout all my objects... This would take HOURS to fix, Gah! "Save Resource As.." doesn't even work if a file by that name already exists.

Fix:
# In "Save Resource" button:

"Save Resource"
"Rename Resource As.."
"Clone Resource As.."
# In "Scene" menu:

"New Scene"
"Open Scene.."
"Save Scene"
"Rename Scene As.."
"Clone Scene As.."
# In "Script" Tab's "File" menu:

"New Script As.." # This is so you can select the type of file (setting it up for easy saving is just a perk).
"Open Script.."
"Save Script"
"Rename Script As.."
"Clone Script As.."

data.body: **\* [drivers\builtin_openssl2\ssl\t1_lib.obj] Error 2

data.title: A couple of viewport bugs.
data.body:
Just a reminder. 
bug N1: rendering to texture flips faces. Flip H fixes that but viewport becomes flipped upside down.
bug N2: materials with alpha enabled are invisible when rendering to texture.
potential bug N3: if you add world environment as a child of viewport and enable fxaa - the picture will become super ugly.
demo:
blenderstars.com/uploads/tmp/tmp_viewport_bugs.zip

data.title: export range does not allow negative values
data.body:
According to wiki this should work:
export(int,-10,20) var j # -10 to 20 allowed
but it doesn't.

data.title: Selecting Text with Shift Mouse Click does not work.
data.body:
If you hold down shift and more the arrow keys it selects text. This should also work when you hold down shift and click somewhere but it does not.

Move the cursor to an end of where you want to highlight by clicking there. Then hold down shift. Then click the other end of where you want to highlight. It should highlight it once this bug is fixed.

data.title: Syntax Checker Bug With ":"
data.body:
When coding there is a syntax checker that highlights incorrect lines in red. It has a huge bug with colons ":"

If you typed out...

```
if (true)
```

...It will turn red, which is correct, with the error:  ':' expected at end of line.
But if you typed out...

```
if (true)
{tab}   complicated(code)
```

...The second line turns red! This makes the programmer think that there is something wrong with the "complicated(code)" and "if (true)" is working perfectly.

Please fix. if ":" is missing at the end of the line, it needs to highlight the correct line, the one that is missing the colon, NOT the next line that is completely unrelated.

data.title: Intellisense Issues with Arrays
data.body:
Intellisense should automatically detect if a variable is an array. This could be done by finding the "var label = []" line and if it is set to an array or empty array assume it is always an array.

When typing an array out it should display Intellisense options as follows {Intellisense popup in curly brackets}...

```
var label = [] #previously somewhere else in code
lab
{ label }
label
{ no intellisense popup }
label. 
{
# on the following lines show argument summeries in Intellisense popup but when selected do not copy what is between the () to code. Also place cursor between ().
.append(var value)
.clear()
.empty()
.erase(var value)
.find(var value) # returns int
# on previous line show the comment in Intellisense popup but when selected do not copy the comment to code.
.hash() # returns int
# on previous line show the comment in Intellisense popup but when selected do not copy the comment to code.
.insert(int pos, var value)
.invert()
.push_back(var value)
.remove(int pos)
.resize(int pos)
.size() # returns int
# on previous line show the comment in Intellisense popup but when selected do not copy the comment to code.
.sort()
.sort_custom(Object obj, String func)
.Array(...)
# replace argument summery with ... when documentation should be referenced.
}
```

data.title: Intellisense Issues
data.body:
While the intellisense popup is on there are a few annoying bugs:
Keys that should close the intellisense popup and work like normal:
    Home Key
    End Key
    Page Up Key
    Page Down Key

Keys that should NOT close the intellisense popup and work like normal:
    Caps Lock Key
    Num Lock Key

data.title: button_group button index bug [WITH SOLUTION]
fix custom export packages for PC
data.body:
this fixes the interface bug with adding "res://" into a path for Linux and Windows custom binary option fields.

it also allow custom templates to reside outside of res:// for all platforms. now there's no need to have separate copies of custom binaries for every project.

data.title: borderless fullscreen window support for x11
data.body:
This adds borderless fullscreen window support for x11.
Also moves the disable resize x11 code from context_gl_x11.cpp to os_x11.cpp.

I tested on Gnome3. alt+tab works.
I tested on Openbox standalone and xfce4. alt+tab works.
I tested on xfce4. alt+tab works in projects that don't set mouse to captured in gdscript.
Doesn't look like Cinnamon is completely in Debian Testing yet (or I'm doing something wrong), and I don't run Ubuntu, so I can't test Unity.

data.title: added settings for default project & export dirs
data.body: I've wanted settings for default project and export directories for a while, and it was also requested on reddit.

data.title: Axis normals broken if not in Z for Sprite3D
data.body:
If Sprite3D's axis is set to anything but Z, the normals are flipped, making lighting visible on the opposite side that the light is on.

![screenshot from 2014-08-22 20 20 04](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1546044/4019541/78b01a4a-2a76-11e4-8106-24603b254731.png)

data.title: Usability: don't switch to resource tab when switching to script tab
data.body:
This simply disables switching to the Resource tab automatically when switching to the Script tab.

Yes, you will now have to click if you ever want to look at the Resource tab. But you no longer have to click every time you want to go back to look at your Scene tree, which is significantly more often, in my experience.

Thanks to Theo for this fix because I was too stupid to find it myself.

data.title: Race condition issue
data.body:
Greetings,

I am not sure if this is a problem with documentation, IDE or godot, on each layer it can be fixed.

I will try to explain.

Godot's tutorial has this code:

```
func goto_scene(scene):
        var s = ResourceLoader.load(scene)
        current_scene.queue_free()
        current_scene = s.instance()
        get_scene().get_root().add_child(current_scene)
```

And let say some scene has:

scene_a.gd:

```
func _ready():
    var node = get_scene().get_root().get_node("Control/Panel") 
    var vs = VSeparator.new()   
    node.add_child(vs)
```

scene_b.gd:

```
func _ready():
    var node = get_scene().get_root().get_node("Control/Panel") 
    var ctrl = Control.new()    
    node.add_child(ctrl)
```

Usually it works, but as number of nodes grows, freeing the queue takes more and more time. Some times user switches scenes so fast, that old Control is not yet freed but new one is connected. Callback _ready is triggered and  get_scene().get_root().get_node("Control/Panel") founds not the Panel on new scene but Panel on old scene that is going to be freed soon. Result is that node is 'null' and godot crashes.

Tree at the moment of crash looks as follow:
 root/Control/Panel/
 root/Control@459/Panel

There is few solutions for this race condition.
1. When adding a node to scene, name is unique, for example let assume that developer adds Control to root of each scene, right now it would be called just Control, while godot can enforce that each node on default is going to get unique id for example Control<some_random_number_or_hash_or_timestamp>, this can later be changed by developer but by default they are unique
2. make node paths per project unique, similar to above but this time godot will crash if given path is already registered
3. get_scene().get_root().get_node() is ignoring scenes that are going to be removed, right now when adding new scene, if there is clash of names new scene is getting Id at the end of node name, while old scene is left intact, make it opposite, so that get_node() will find Control from new scene but not old
4. add for autoloader documentation remark that free is asynchronous and it's strongly recommended to use unique names for important nodes as there might be clash of paths in between queue.free and add_child

General remark.

As far as I can tell such race condition exists, however if I am wrong and it's my error, please let me know what I am doing wrong. In such case it might be useful to update wiki as well (section regarding scene autoloader/switcher, might be a good one).

data.title: Fixed copy process of stream of bytes for HttpClient.
data.body:
Previously if request was not chunked and longer than arbitrary chunk of
4096 bytes, rest was truncated. With this commit, we will copy
everything we have in the memmory.
